snippet: Twenty whales believed to be part of a pod found stranded in the Everglades this week were spotted Friday afternoon moving closer toward shore.
abstract: Twenty whales believed to be part of a pod found stranded in the Florida Everglades are spotted moving closer toward shore, sign they may be reversing their earlier, positive, course; officials say whales seem less organized and may be exhausted.
lead_paragraph: Twenty whales believed to be part of a pod found stranded in the Everglades this week were spotted Friday afternoon moving closer toward shore.

headline.main: Florida: Reversal in Course Signals Whales May Be Ill
headline.print_headline: Florida: Reversal In Course Signals Whales May Be Ill
